Module “wavelet”¶

wavelet(y1[, dt, lag1, s0, dj, param, ...]) Compute the wavelet transform of a 1D time series.
wave_signif(y, dt, scale[, dof, sigtest, ...]) The function compute the significance levels for a wavelet transform.
wave_coherency(time1, time2, scale1, scale2, ...) The function compute the wavelet coherency between two time series.
acorrelation(x, lag) The function returns the autocorrelation.
acovariance(x, lag) The function returns the autocovariance.
bisectpdf(a, up, below) The function computes the cutoff value a such that the probabilty of an observation from the given distribution, less than x, is a(0).
chisqrcvf(p, df) The function computes the cutoff value V in a chi-square
chisqrpdf(v, df) The function computes the probability P that, in a chi-square
complexv(x, y) The function returns complex scalars or arrays from two scalars or arrays.
rebin(a, new_shape) The function resizes an array by averaging or repeating elements, new dimensions must be integral factors of original dimensions.
Dog(k, scale[, k0]) DOG (derivative of Gaussian) wavelet transform.
Morlet(k, scale[, k0]) Morlet wavelet transform.
Paul(k, scale[, k0]) Paul wavelet transform.
